name: Pesto
description:
Be sure to rinse and dry the basil leaves well. I give mine a shake outside my kitchen window. I haven’t lost a leaf yet. (Although some of the people down below on the sidewalk might wonder where that basil-scented mist is coming from.) Those of you who prefer to live less vicariously can use a salad spinner or shake them in a tea towel.

If using a food processor or blender, or similar device, I recommend grinding up the nuts, garlic and cheese first, then adding the remaining ingredients and pureeing them until smooth. No need to pre-chop the basil leaves – just add them right in, and stop the food processor a few times to scrape down the sides as you go.
recipeIngredient: 1/4 cup (30g) pine nuts (walnuts, or shelled pistachios, very lightly toasted)

recipeInstructions.text: Smash the garlic and salt together in a mortar and pestle until smooth. (You can also use a blender or food processor. See headnote for instructions)
recipeInstructions.name: Smash the garlic and salt together in a mortar and pestle until smooth. (You can also use a blender or food processor. See headnote for instructions)

recipeInstructions.text: Coarsely chop the basil leaves, then add them to the mortar and pounding them into the garlic as you add them.
recipeInstructions.name: Coarsely chop the basil leaves, then add them to the mortar and pounding them into the garlic as you add them.

recipeInstructions.text: Once well-mashed, when they’ve become a fairly smooth paste, pound in the olive oil, adding it a spoonful at a time, until well-incorporated.
recipeInstructions.name: Once well-mashed, when they’ve become a fairly smooth paste, pound in the olive oil, adding it a spoonful at a time, until well-incorporated.

recipeInstructions.text: Lastly, pound in the cheese, then the pine nuts.
recipeInstructions.name: Lastly, pound in the cheese, then the pine nuts.

recipeInstructions.text: Continue mashing everything for a few minutes until the pesto is as smooth as possible.
recipeInstructions.name: Continue mashing everything for a few minutes until the pesto is as smooth as possible.
